description: Manage Azure NetApp Files (ANF) Snapshot Resources.

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot create
commands.summary: Create the specified snapshot within the given volume.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles snapshot create --account-name
                               --name
                               --pool-name
                               --resource-group
                               --volume-name
                               [--location]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az netappfiles snapshot create -g mygroup --account-name myaccname --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolname --name mysnapname -l eastus

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot delete
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles snapshot delete [--account-name]
                               [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--pool-name]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--volume-name]
                               [--yes]
examples: az netappfiles snapshot delete -g mygroup --account-name myaccname --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolname --name mysnapname

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot list
commands.summary: List all snapshots associated with the volume.
examples: az netappfiles snapshot list -g mygroup --account-name myaccname --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolname

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot restore-files
commands.summary: Restore the specified files from the specified snapshot to the active filesystem.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles snapshot restore-files --file-paths
                                      [--account-name]
                                      [--destination-path]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--pool-name]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--volume-name]
examples: az netappfiles snapshot restore-files -g mygroup --account-name myaccname --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolname --name mysnapname --file-paths myfilepaths

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot show
commands.summary: Get details of the specified snapshot.
examples: az netappfiles snapshot show -g mygroup --account-name myaccname --pool-name mypoolname --volume-name myvolname --name mysnapname

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot update
commands.summary: Update the specified snapshot within the given volume.
commands.syntax:
az netappfiles snapshot update [--account-name]
                               [--add]
                               [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--ids]
                               [--name]
                               [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                               [--pool-name]
                               [--remove]
                               [--resource-group]
                               [--set]
                               [--subscription]
                               [--volume-name]

commands.name: az netappfiles snapshot wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
